verses.roman:
prathame calilā prabhu,--yena vāyu-gati
stambha-bhāva pathe haila, calite nāhi śakti

synonyms: prathame—in the beginning; calilā—went; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; yena—like; vāyu-gati—the speed of the wind; stambha-bhāva—the emotion of being stunned; pathe—on the way; haila—there was; calite—to move; nāhi—no; śakti—power.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu was running with the speed of the wind, but He suddenly became stunned in ecstasy and lost all strength to proceed further.
